sort_ex

Extensions to std.algorithm.sort.

.

void sortBy(alias xtor, R)(R r) if (isRandomAccessRange!R && isAggregateType!(ElementType!R));
Sort Random Access Range of Aggregates on Value of Calls to . See also: http://forum.dlang.org/thread/nqwzojnlidlsmpunpqqy@forum.dlang.org#post-dmfvkbfhzigecnwglrur:40forum.dlang.org

void rsortBy(alias xtor, R)(R r) if (isRandomAccessRange!R && isAggregateType!(ElementType!R));
Reverse Sort Random Access Range of Aggregates on Value of Calls to . See also: http://forum.dlang.org/thread/nqwzojnlidlsmpunpqqy@forum.dlang.org#post-dmfvkbfhzigecnwglrur:40forum.dlang.org

auto sorted(R, E = ElementType!R)(R r);
Returns:
sorted. If needed a GC-copy of is allocated, sorted and returned. See also: http://forum.dlang.org/thread/tnrvudehinmkvbifovwo@forum.dlang.org#post-tnrvudehinmkvbifovwo:40forum.dlang.org TODO Add to Phobos

Examples:
assert(equal("öaA".sorted, "Aaö"));
assert(equal("öaA"w.sorted, "Aaö"));
assert(equal("öaA"d.sorted, "Aaö"));


Examples:
import std.algorithm.sorting : sort;
auto x = "öaA"d;
auto y = sort(x.dup).sorted; // parameter to sorted is a SortedRange
assert(equal(y, "Aaö"));


Examples:
import std.algorithm.sorting : sort;
immutable x = [3, 2, 1];
auto y = x.dup;
sort(y);
assert(equal(x.sorted, y));


Examples:
import std.container: Array;
auto x = Array!int(3, 2, 1);
assert(equal(x.sorted, [1, 2, 3]));


Examples:
import std.container: SList;
auto x = SList!int(3, 2, 1);
assert(equal(x.sorted, [1, 2, 3]));


auto randomlyShuffled(Range, RandomGen)(Range r, ref RandomGen gen);
Functional version of 
std.random.randomShuffle
.

Returns:
randomly shuffled.

If needed a GC-copy of is allocated, sorted and returned.

auto randomlyShuffled(Range)(Range r);
Examples:
immutable x = [3, 2, 1];
auto y = x.dup;
Random random;
y.randomlyShuffled(random);
